reviews.text:
Historic building
And delightful staff that keep
JC running smooth.

“The City Hall of Jersey City is an elaborate granite and marble structure of mixed Victorian and Classical architecture. It was designed by the architect Lewis H. Broome (1849-1927) and completed in 1896.“
Extremely rude and unhelpful. Asked to be transferred to an employee and they literally told me "I don't know how to help you"

Cultural affairs regular staff is very rude and treats the summer workers as if they don't matter because they're almost expendable but they don't respect them in general as the young ambitious men and women that want to work for the summer
Diversity
The clock itself is cool but the view and surrounding pier is what makes it a good spot! Many families with kids riding scooters and bikes. Couple good restaurants nearby!

One of the places which literally had my hair standing. The New York Skyline that you get to see from here is breathtaking.  Again the place is totally free and easily accessible through public transport. You can just sit there or walk on the boardwalk or hangout with your friends. A dreamy place for me.
Cool spot to visit. Although I did go when it was colder, bundle up it gets cold there. The place has great views of Manhattan. The clock itself is great for photo ops of yourself or your family.

I love this place. The best view of the city from the calmest place in jersey. There are benches to sit and enjoy the view, this place is a great spot to hang around on a summer night! With cool breeze and awesome view, this place is suitable to spend time with family or friends.

It's a Clock. That says Colgate on it. Not much more to say about it.
Although the scenery is nice. You can see parts of the Statue of Liberty and The Freedom tower

Only reason I took away a star is cause you have to pay for parking with admission. Great place for kids (preferably 2+). My son had a blast running around experiencing everything there is to touch. Even my wife and I had a great time learning new things.
This is an amazing place. You can spend the entire day. Lots to do and see. A lit of interactive activities. And any show in the dome is amazing. Bring the kids

Pretty solid science center. There is lots to do for young kids but there is also enough information presented to keep adults entertained. There is quite a good variety of exhibits as well as movie experiences, including a very nice planetarium. It is a bit on the expensive side to get in and any movies aren't included.

Treat it as science center where you take your kids and explore vs. science museum. There are not a lot of contents for adults as it mostly presents interactive exhibition for kids. In the weekend, it will be filled with kids and family. 

The Sherlock Holmes special exhibition is really well designed and cool. Highly recommend!

This is home to the biggest dome in the western hemisphere!
We visited this place on a weekend to catch some astronomy shows, the place itself was not so crowded and the wait time to obtain the show tickets was not that long.
One of the attractive science exhibit was that of the Tesla electricity generation coil, wherein visitors had a chance to experience the fabulous display of electricity in a dark environment which was cool.
We also got a chance to catch 2 planetarium shows one on black holes and other on wonders of night sky. The dome is an absolute delight to the senses, The guides toned down their language to cater to the general public even those who are not very familiar with concepts in astronomy.
Great place to visit on a date night.

Only reason I took away a star is cause you have to pay for parking with admission. Great place for kids (preferably 2+). My son had a blast running around experiencing everything there is to touch. Even my wife and I had a great time learning new things.
This is an amazing place. You can spend the entire day. Lots to do and see. A lit of interactive activities. And any show in the dome is amazing. Bring the kids

Pretty solid science center. There is lots to do for young kids but there is also enough information presented to keep adults entertained. There is quite a good variety of exhibits as well as movie experiences, including a very nice planetarium. It is a bit on the expensive side to get in and any movies aren't included.

Treat it as science center where you take your kids and explore vs. science museum. There are not a lot of contents for adults as it mostly presents interactive exhibition for kids. In the weekend, it will be filled with kids and family. 

The Sherlock Holmes special exhibition is really well designed and cool. Highly recommend!

This is home to the biggest dome in the western hemisphere!
We visited this place on a weekend to catch some astronomy shows, the place itself was not so crowded and the wait time to obtain the show tickets was not that long.
One of the attractive science exhibit was that of the Tesla electricity generation coil, wherein visitors had a chance to experience the fabulous display of electricity in a dark environment which was cool.
We also got a chance to catch 2 planetarium shows one on black holes and other on wonders of night sky. The dome is an absolute delight to the senses, The guides toned down their language to cater to the general public even those who are not very familiar with concepts in astronomy.
Great place to visit on a date night.

This place is awesome! Nothing fancy, but really great bagels. Inexpensive too. Guys are friendly & service was quick. Great breakfast sandwich. 
Had bacon, egg & cheese bagel - huge & yummy. Ordered more bagels to bring home!
A fantastic neighbourhood bagel shop. Everything freshly made to order (so it can take a while!). Really reasonable prices and huge portions of fillings. Good coffee.

Love it - my go to place most mornings in NJ.  Fantastic bagels, relatively inexpensive and a great local business.  Huge range of spreads and the guys are extremely generous in applying them.  

Highly recommend the sausage, egg and cheese on everything.  So so good.

This place is great! great food great people working there as well. very friendly, and quick to get your meal to you.

However in my experience, sometimes they don't fully listen. I've had some of my meals messed or not exactly how i asked for it. 
For instance, i asked would ask for a cup of decaf with 3 sugars and extra cream; they'd give with little cream and no sugar.
sometimes i ask for a thin spread of Olive Pimento and they'd give me a lot.

Otherwise a great place to get a meal.

Fantastic bagels, it was made obvious with the line that had formed. The line moved quickly and efficiently. 

We ended up getting a dozen to bring back down to DC since apparently no one knows how to make a proper bagel down here. The amount of salmon and whitefish on the sandwiches was fantastic

Spontaneously decided to go in here yesterday and boy was I glad I tried it! I didn’t realize it was pretty authentic Dominican restaurant! I was pleasantly surprised. 

I got their beef stew with yellow rice and my friend had the chicken stew with rice and beans! Both items tasted really good! 

The staff was friendly and service was fast! Will definitely be going back to try more of their items!

Great food (love me some mangu and mofongo😋), staff and inexpensive prices. I'm new to the area so I was delighted to find a true Dominican spot in Jersey City. The service is usually fast. The menu changes throughout the day so I recommend calling ahead to get the daily specials.

I go there for lunch every day.  I love this place.  They have a wide variety of selections and the prices are very reasonable.  Also the portions are very big.  You can eat thru dinner.  The ladies are very competent and respectecful. I have nothing better to say.
Very nice employees and food is delish
Great had  a really good chicken noodle soup with white rice to fight of this cold. Price was good too.

I liked the salsa and chips. Our waitress was very distant or busy. The food we ordered was not brought out correctly. Because our waitress was so distant it was hard to get a correction made. Someone else had to go get her. Our drinks ran empty on more than one occasion and we were handed our tab without being offered dessert which I ordered after another waitress noticed me looking around AGAIN. They were not busy by any means we were one of maybe 10 people in the establishment. I usually pop in during lunch. Maybe I will leave it that way from now on. Disapointed on Wednesday@6

Fiesta Grill has become one of my favorites. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is cozy, to me. The food is really good. I recommend the beef enchiladas, so tasty. Good place to eat either by yourself or with friends and family. They have bigger tables for large groups.

Food was ok, service good. Do NOT offer Military or senior discount. Will NOT visit or become a regular patron to a Restaurant that do not offer these types of discounts,  mainly because a good number of seniors have served in the military so businesses like this one can exist. The least an establishment like this one should do is to show its gratitude to military service members.
Went there for the last time. Hair in to go cup. Food tastes like the kind you get in the frozen food section.
Small town service and feel is great. If you like your Mexican food lightly spiced, you will like this place.
Amazing authentic mexican food... Definitely coming back. After ages, I could devour something that reminded me of roadside Mexican tacos.. definitely will be back.

Taqueria has the best tacos in the area hands down. The delicious lame tacos are a must - and what appears to be freshly made tortilla chips and salsa will tempt you into ruining your appetite - so be careful. The joint itself oozes charm and can get a bit loud at night. But it's worth it for the excellent food and drinks. I swing out here from Hoboken for this place alone.

My husband and I came here on a random whim for date night. We were not expecting what we walked into. We've gone by this corner dozens of times without realizing this place existed. Inside it's tiny, limited first come, first served seating and it's super super casual. No frills, no cheesy Mexican decor...it's just about the food. We were there very late on a Sunday and the place was consistently packed with people flowing in steadily for a seat and for takeout. Everyone in the place was raving about the food for good reason. It's simple but authentic and really good! Price can't be beat either....we ordered A LOT of food and two margaritas (which are very strong!!) and our bill was just about $60...not bad at all. We'll be back. Definitely check this place out. Guac and salsa are outstanding
This location is closer to me and they deliver. I started off by going to the other location, but I'm happy to report that this location lives up to the taqueria standard. Both great!
Very authentic food. We have had take out a few times when visiting the area. The actual restaurant has only a few tables and a small bar. All of our friends love the place.
Great spot, friendly atmosphere, as well as the staff, and Happy hour Specials are on point, as well as the food and drinks. Big ups to Mike, the bartender,  straight up guy, always keeping it💯.
Good cuban food.  Nice drinks.  Several types of Mojitos and Sangria.  All were good.  Great place to hang with friends.
It was great when they were in the old location and it's still a nice spot with great drinks and very good service. Went to celebrate my girls birthday early. Definitely going back.
The place looks amazing and the service was good! The food was very delicious 😊

My coworkers and I threw a surprise bridal shower for our fellow coworker at Hard Grove, and it was the most wonderful experience. Anna helped me to plan the event every step of the way. She was very quick with email responses and very thorough about pricing and packages. She helped to create the perfect, affordable menu for all of us and accommodated our needs of bringing a cake, and decorations. All of the staff was extremely helpful from the moment we walked in. They helped me decorate and asked our preferences of how we wanted to be seated and when the food should come out. The food was absolutely delicious and is so filling! We had an array of appetizers- plantain chips and guacamole, a variety of empanadas, and ham croquettes- all so delicious. We had 2 choices for our main course- rice and chicken or a vegetarian meal. Everyone was very pleased and super full! We also ordered drinks to the table and the most popular drink seemed to be the pitchers of sangria. Great price and a great amount of sangria. The music and atmosphere was so fun. The waiters were always smiling, taking pictures for us, and seemed to be having fun as well.  We all had a wonderful night and we are so thankful for the hospitality and delicious food we had at Hard Grove. We will all be back very soon! 😊

Wow! What a gem on 4th. Went with a group of friends for brunch on a recommendation and was not disappointed. Before I get ahead of myself, reservations are extremely recommended on Friday, Saturday, Sunday. With that being said you want to make one here. Decor is fantastic, many handcrafted pieces. Rustic yet elegant. Our server Roger was quick, witty and charming. Service was speedy, never felt rushed. We ordered a few different items and all were delicious. Their drink of the day was delightful! We also tried all the desserts on the brunch menu -‘cause why not?!- and surprise! Scrumptious! We enjoyed this place so much we have all decided to make this our next date night spot. Thank you for the great food and experience!

Good food, but a bit overpriced. We really liked the mushroom appetizer (I think it was a special of the day). The duck was also very good. The seafood special was OK. The flourless chocolate cake was very rich and good with the ice cream, but we needed more ice cream. We brought half home and enjoyed it with more ice cream.

Now that the menu is limited if you are vegetarian.
Such a lovely place for the Valentine’s Day dinner. Super delicious food and fun live music, made my day! Will be back for sure!

the overall vibe of this restaurant is amazing! the exposed brick- live music on Thursday's and the escargot is the best i've ever had... definitely a place you should check out!! Roger was an awesome waiter too :)

Consistently great food and service...Been here 4-5 times in the past year...The duck and lamb shank are always amazing... Also, the goat special is great when offered..Check out the signature cocktails and don't forget dessert...

Great food, hostess was gorgeous and very nice. This place is for the milder curry lovers and great if you are bringing people to try Indian for the first time. However....my truck got booted and the ransom was 60 bucks. Note...DO NO PARK ON THE MCDONALD'S SIDE OF THE RESTAURANT.

The atmosphere is beautiful.  We loved the sauces, rice, and naan but the chicken and lamb were too tough and didn't taste very good.  They were short-staffed the night we went but our waitress was nice.

The standard Indian fare can be found here, with some very tasty additions.  I was very impressed with the coconut tomato soup - I'll definitely be coming back for more!  The thalis are large, but not quite as diverse as one can find elsewhere.

Great buffet style Indian restaurant. Loved the vegetarian options. The chicken curry was a little sweet, but you get fresh naan delivered to your table and masala tea on the buffet as well. I will definitely be back here! The atmosphere is cozy and inviting; the chairs are great! It's like being in a friend's living room. A must for lunch. :)

Just went their to lunch today. It was a buffet for 10$ (tip+tax included) and I have to say the food was just delicious. Definitely the best Indian restaurant I ever tried in Abq. Everything was so tasteful and there was a great variety of vegetarian food (even if the best was the chicken). Service was very good; but I gotta say for a buffet you dont expect much. Our waitress was so nice, she came to ask several times if everything was fine and even gave us a bunch of naan bread to eat later on the day.

Recommended 100% 

Did not go for dinner yet, so no idea about the menu/price/service, but the lunch was so good that I'm sure you can find amazingly good tasting food.
